DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score for the assessment of epiglotic movement in the pharyngeal impairment section of the Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile Pharyngeal Impairment During Swallowing Impairment of Epiglottic Movement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function._An assessment of an individual's pharyngeal impairment during swallowing._An observation of an individual's epiglottic movement during swallowing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function.

Concepts.definition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function.

Property.preferredName: Pharyngeal Impairment During Swallowing Impairment of Epiglottic Movement
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment of an individual's pharyngeal impairment during swallowing.:An observation of an individual's epiglottic movement during swallowing.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of an individual's pharyngeal impairment during swallowing.
An observation of an individual's epiglottic movement during swallowing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: MBSImP:Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile, Martin-Harris et al., 2008
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret study in Rave as requested by D.Lawrence. mc 6/8/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of no inversion of epiglottis during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: No Inversion of Epiglottis During Swallowing
Concepts.definition: A finding of no inversion of epiglottis during swallowing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of partial inversion of epiglottis during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Partial Inversion of Epiglottis During Swallowing
Concepts.definition: A finding of partial inversion of epiglottis during swallowing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of complete inversion of epiglottis during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Complete Inversion of Epiglottis During Swallowing
Concepts.definition: A finding of complete inversion of epiglottis during swallowing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
